pull.title: tests: Add fuzzing harness for CScript and CScriptNum operations
pull.body:
Add fuzzing harness for `CScript` and `CScriptNum` operations.

Test this PR using:

```
$ make distclean
$ ./autogen.sh
$ CC=clang CXX=clang++ ./configure --enable-fuzz \
      --with-sanitizers=address,fuzzer,undefined
$ make
$ src/test/fuzz/script_ops
…
$ src/test/fuzz/scriptnum_ops
…
```

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

issue.title: tests: Add harness which fuzzes EvalScript and VerifyScript using a fuzzed signature checker
issue.body:
Add harness which fuzzes `EvalScript` and `VerifyScript` using a fuzzed signature checker.

Test this PR using:

```
$ make distclean
$ ./autogen.sh
$ CC=clang CXX=clang++ ./configure --enable-fuzz \
      --with-sanitizers=address,fuzzer,undefined
$ make
$ src/test/fuzz/signature_checker
…
```

Closes #17986.

rename.from: tests: Add fuzzing harness for CScript operations
rename.to: tests: Add fuzzing harness for CScript and CScriptNum operations

events.body: @MarcoFalke Added `CScriptNum` fuzzer too. Moved common functions to `fuzz.h`. Please re-review :)

issue.title: tests: Add fuzzing harness for Golomb-Rice coding (GolombRiceEncode/GolombRiceDecode)
issue.body:
Add fuzzing harness for Golomb-Rice coding (`GolombRiceEncode`/`GolombRiceDecode`).

Test this PR using:

```
$ make distclean
$ ./autogen.sh
$ CC=clang CXX=clang++ ./configure --enable-fuzz \
      --with-sanitizers=address,fuzzer,undefined
$ make
$ src/test/fuzz/golomb_rice
…
```

issue.title: tests: Add fuzzing harness for bloom filter classes (CBloomFilter + CRollingBloomFilter)
issue.body:
Add fuzzing harness for bloom filter classes (`CBloomFilter` + `CRollingBloomFilter`).

Test this PR using:

```
$ make distclean
$ ./autogen.sh
$ CC=clang CXX=clang++ ./configure --enable-fuzz \
      --with-sanitizers=address,fuzzer,undefined
$ make
$ src/test/fuzz/bloom_filter
…
$ src/test/fuzz/rolling_bloom_filter
…
```

events.body: @MarcoFalke Thanks for reviewing. All feedback addressed. Please re-review :)

issue.title: Bitcoin PR tracking
issue.body: The main purpose of this issue is to keep track of Pull Requests on Bitcoin since version 0.19.1 identifying those which make a porting LitecoinZ.

issue.title: Merge #18612: script: Remove undocumented and unused operator+
issue.body:
ccccd5190898ece3ac17aa3178f320d091f221df script: Remove undocumented and unused operator+ (MarcoFalke)

Merge #18612: script: Remove undocumented and unused operator+

Pull request description:

  This operator has no documented use case and is also unused outside of test code. The test code and all other (imaginary) code that might use this operator is written more clear and concise by the existing CScript push operators for opcodes and data.

  Removing the operator is also going to protect against accidentally reintroducing bugs like this https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/6ff5f718b6a67797b2b3bab8905d607ad216ee21#diff-8458adcedc17d046942185cb709ff5c3L1135 (last time it was used).

ACKs for top commit:
  laanwj:
    ACK ccccd5190898ece3ac17aa3178f320d091f221df

Tree-SHA512: 43898ac77e4d9643d9f8ac6f8f65497a4f0bbb1fb5dcaecc839c3719aa36181ba77befb213e59a9f33a20a29e0173a0e9c4763b1930940b32c3d1598b3e39af9

comments.body:
Can combine case 0 and 1?

```cpp
const auto int = fuzzed_data_provider.ConsumeIntegral<int64_t>()
(script_num == int) != (script_num != int)
```

Could combine these?

```cpp
(script_num - int ) + int == script_num
(script_num + int ) - int == script_num

Also in commit 4532649:

No input is consumed from the fuzzer, so this doesn't need to be special cased and can be executed unconditionally?
Oh, of course. Now fixed. Thanks!
